  "document_summary": "This issue of the Kuwait Today official gazette, dated December 15, 2024, provides a comprehensive overview of governmental activities, legal proceedings, and public notices in Kuwait. Key contents include decrees from the Council of Ministers, notably concerning the withdrawal of Kuwaiti nationality, and various ministerial decisions regulating sectors such as car rental, exchange companies, and industrial operations, alongside numerous administrative penalties and plot closures. A significant portion is dedicated to extensive tender announcements and postponements from a wide array of ministries, public authorities, and state-owned oil companies for projects spanning IT, infrastructure, medical supplies, and services. Additionally, the gazette features official announcements on company dissolutions, liquidations, commercial agency registrations, amendments to civil records (births, deaths, names, IDs), public auctions for vehicles and real estate, and detailed criminal judgments from Kuwaiti courts. ## Decree No. 213 of 2024
### Regarding the Withdrawal of Kuwaiti Citizenship from Certain Persons
– Having reviewed the Constitution,
– And Amiri Order issued on 2 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1445 AH, corresponding to 10 May 2024 AD,
– And Amiri Decree No. 15 of 1959 regarding the Kuwaiti Nationality Law, and its amending laws,
– And based on the submission of the First Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Interior,
– And after the approval of the Council of Ministers,
We have decreed the following:
Article One
Kuwaiti citizenship shall be withdrawn from those mentioned below and from those who acquired it through dependency with them:

## Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>
### Decree No. 212 of 2024
### Regarding the Withdrawal of Kuwaiti Citizenship from a Person
Having reviewed the Constitution,
And Amiri Order issued on 2 Dhu al-Qi'dah 1445 AH, corresponding to 10 May 2024 AD,
And Amiri Decree No. 15 of 1959 regarding the Kuwaiti Nationality Law, and its amending laws,
And based on the submission of the First Deputy Prime Minister and Minister of Interior,
And after the approval of the Council of Ministers,
We have decreed the following:
Article One
Kuwaiti citizenship shall be withdrawn from / Sami Ghaid Saud Mahawish <orig>سامي غايد سعود مهاوش</orig>, and from those who acquired it through dependency with him.

After reviewing the documents and the Secretary's letter dated 02/12/2024 requesting authorization to announce the bankruptcy proceedings report and the provisional list of debts for the bankrupt / Fahad Abdulaziz Al-Sanea <orig>فهد عبدالعزيز الصانع</orig>, and in accordance with the provisions of the Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig> and its Executive Regulations:

<page_start>26</page_start>
<page_metadata>
{
  "page_title": "Official Gazette - Issue 1717 <orig>الجريدة الرسمية - العدد 1717</orig>",
  "document_date": "2024-12-15",

  "page_summary": "This page details legal articles 131 and 132 concerning bankruptcy procedures, outlines the court's review of a specific bankruptcy case, and references Law No. 71 of 2020 regarding the conditions for declaring a merchant bankrupt and the scope of the law."
}
</page_metadata>
<header>
26 A
Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig> Issue 1717, Seventy-First Year
Sunday, 14 Jumada Al-Akhira 1446 AH - 15/12/2024 AD
</header>
952 K.D.
This is established by the judgment in lawsuit No. 1123/2019 Commercial Plenary/14, its appeal No. 3742/2019 Commercial/12, and its cassation No. 3581/2019 Commercial/6. The aforementioned amount was recorded against her. Furthermore, the second defendant, in his capacity as a merchant and manager of the first defendant, bears responsibility for the debts of the first defendant due to his engagement in acts of fraud and deception during his management of it and his deliberate concealment of its books to prevent the plaintiff from collecting her debts, which led her to submit her aforementioned request.
The court reviewed the application file and the procedures taken by the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig>, where it examined the report of the Bankruptcy Committee <orig>لجنة الإفلاس</orig>, which concluded that it was impossible to study and prepare a report on the debtor - the first defendant - due to the unavailability of data on its financial position. The court also reviewed the report of the bankruptcy trustee appointed by a decision of the bankruptcy judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig>. Attached to the application file was the judgment in lawsuit No. 1123/2019 Commercial Plenary/14, its appeal No. 3742/2019 Commercial/12, and its cassation No. 3581/2019 Commercial/6, as well as a portfolio of documents submitted by the plaintiff, which the court reviewed. The procedures concluded with a decision by the bankruptcy judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> to commence bankruptcy proceedings for Al-Mutawa and Al-Khatib Garments Company <orig>شركة المطوع والخطيب للملابس الجاهزة</orig> and to set 08/10/2019 as a provisional date for cessation of payments. The application was then referred to this circuit by a decision of the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> and registered under its number.
Since the lawsuit was deliberated as established in the session minutes, the plaintiff was represented by a lawyer acting on her behalf, who insisted on the requests. Falah Al-Mutairi <orig>فلاح المطيري</orig> also appeared on behalf of the first defendant in his capacity as the bankruptcy trustee and requested the declaration of bankruptcy of the first defendant. The court therefore decided to issue its judgment in today's session.
Regarding the subject matter of the lawsuit and the plaintiff's request for the declaration of bankruptcy of Al-Mutawa and Al-Khatib Garments Company <orig>شركة المطوع والخطيب للملابس الجاهزة</orig> - the first defendant - it is stipulated by Article 1 of Bankruptcy Law No. 71 of 2020 <orig>قانون الإفلاس رقم 71 لسنة 2020</orig>, which states that, for the application of the provisions of this law, the following words and phrases shall have the meaning assigned to each of them: ...... Financial insolvency: the debtor's assets are insufficient to pay his debts.
Article 2 of the same law stipulates that "The provisions of this law apply to: - 1- Every natural person proven to be a merchant. 2- Kuwaiti companies."
Article 131 of the same law stipulates that "The bankruptcy judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> shall issue his decision to commence bankruptcy proceedings if the following conditions are met: 1- The debtor has ceased payments. 2- There is a deficit in the debtor's financial position. 3- The debtor's business is not viable for continuity."
Article 132 of the same law stipulates that "In all cases where the bankruptcy judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> issues his decision to commence bankruptcy proceedings, the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> shall refer the application file for the commencement of proceedings to the Bankruptcy Court <orig>محكمة الإفلاس</orig> within ten days from the date of the bankruptcy judge's decision to commence bankruptcy proceedings, and a report on the procedures taken for the application from its submission until the issuance of the decision to commence proceedings, along with a statement of the factual and legal grounds for the decision, shall be deposited in the file."
It has been established, and as held by the Court of Cassation <orig>محكمة التمييز</orig>, "that the trial court has full authority to examine the evidence and documents submitted to it, to prefer what it deems reliable, to deduce what it believes to be the reality of the case, and its assessment thereof and determining its sufficiency for conviction is solely within its purview, provided that this assessment is reasonable and does not deviate from what is established in the case documents...".
(Appeals Nos. 555, 599/2005 Commercial, Session 08/10/2006)
Based on the foregoing and guided by it, and since the plaintiff's aim in this request is the declaration of bankruptcy of the first defendant due to its cessation of payment of the debt owed to her, and it is legally established for the declaration of bankruptcy of a debtor that several conditions must be met: proof of his status as a merchant, his cessation of payment of a debt owed by him due to a deficit in his financial position, and that his business is not viable for continuity. Upon the court's examination of the case documents and the application submitted to the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> and the procedures taken therein, it finds that these conditions apply to the first defendant, as it was proven that it refrained from paying a debt owed by it, established by a final and enforceable judgment, due to its financial insolvency, which resulted in the issuance of a decision to commence its bankruptcy proceedings by the bankruptcy judge <orig>قاضي الإفلاس</orig> and the appointment of a trustee for it, in accordance with the aforementioned Article 132. Whereby the court finds the procedures undertaken by the Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> and its judge in handling the present application to be valid, and therefore, the plaintiff's request for the declaration of bankruptcy of the first defendant is based on sound factual and legal grounds, and the court rules for the declaration of bankruptcy of the first defendant - Al-Mutawa and Al-Khatib Garments Company <orig>شركة المطوع والخطيب للملابس الجاهزة</orig> - as will be stated in the operative part of the judgment.
And regarding the plaintiff's request for the declaration of bankruptcy of the second defendant, Tariq <orig>طارق</orig>

  "publisher": "Al-Kuwait Al-Youm / Kuwait Today <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>",
  "page_summary": "This page presents an administrative decision from the Ministry of Information to cancel the electronic media license for 'News 24' and details a court judgment declaring the bankruptcy of Al-Mutawa and Al-Khatib Ready-Made Garments Company, outlining the legal basis for both."

- And based on the request submitted by the license holder on 28/11/2024,
- And based on the letter from the Director of the Electronic Publishing Department <orig>مدير إدارة النشر الإلكتروني</orig> No. 139 dated 03/12/2024,
- And as required by the public interest.
It was decided
### Article One
License No. 2021/502 for the media outlet "News 24" is hereby revoked by operation of law, based on the request of the license holder, in implementation of the last paragraph of Article (16) of Law No. (8) of 2016 regulating electronic media, as referred to.
### Article Two
This decision shall be notified to the concerned parties and published on the Ministry's website and in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.

Mohammed Al-Khatib <orig>محمد الخطيب</orig> in his personal capacity and as manager and partner in the First Defendant,
It is established by the Court of Cassation <orig>قضاء التمييز</orig> that "companies acquire a legal personality independent of the persons of their partners, and a consequence of this is that they have an independent financial liability separate from the liabilities of their partners. The appellant, being a limited liability company, has its own legal personality and financial liability independent of the liabilities of its partners, given that each partner is liable to the extent of their share in the company. The latter is the original debtor who obtained credit facilities from the First Respondent Bank, and therefore it is responsible for the resulting obligations, regardless of any change in the persons of its partners." (Appeal No. 340 of 2012 Commercial, Session 19/05/2015)
And it was established that "a limited liability company has a legal personality independent of the liability of its partners, and therefore, the manager representing this company, in this capacity, has a financial liability separate from his personal liability."
(Appeal No. 1113 of 2006 Commercial, Session 08/01/2008)
Given this, and it being established that the First Defendant company is a limited liability company, its liability is therefore separate from the liability of its manager and partners. Since the Second Defendant is a manager and partner in the First Defendant, he is only liable for its debts to the extent of his share in the company. Accordingly, the plaintiff's request to declare the Second Defendant bankrupt is based on an incorrect premise because his financial liability is separate from that of the First Defendant. The Court rules to reject this request as will be stated in the operative part of the judgment.
As for the expenses, including legal fees, the Court obliges the First Defendant to bear them, in accordance with the provisions of Article 1/119 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> and Article 23 of the Bankruptcy Law <orig>قانون الإفلاس</orig>.
(For these reasons)
**The Court ruled: to declare the First Defendant / Al-Mutawa and Al-Khatib Garments Company <orig>شركة المطوع والخطيب للملابس الجاهزة</orig> bankrupt, and to set 08/10/2019 as the provisional date for cessation of payments. The Bankruptcy Department <orig>إدارة الإفلاس</orig> shall register this judgment in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig> and publish a summary thereof in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with the procedures followed in this regard, and to add the expenses and an amount of ten Dinars <orig>دنانير</orig> for legal fees to be borne by the bankruptcy estate, and rejected all other requests.**

Assistant Undersecretary
for the Press, Publishing and Printed Materials Sector

Session Secretary
Judge

  "page_summary": "This page presents Ministerial Decision No. (231) of 2024 from the Ministry of Commerce and Industry, which regulates car rental contracts by outlining specific obligations for lessors and lessees, including vehicle condition, insurance, and dispute resolution, and refers to penalties for non-compliance."

*   Decree-Law No. (10) of 1979 regarding the Supervision of Trading in Goods, Services, and Handicrafts and the Determination of Prices for Some of Them, as amended by Law No. (45) of 1980 and Law No. (117) of 2013, and its Executive Regulations,
*   Decree-Law No. (68) of 1980 regarding the Issuance of the Commercial Law and its Amendments,
*   Decree No. (191) of 2015 regarding the Organization of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>,
*   And Law No. 39 of 2015 regarding Consumer Protection and its Executive Regulations,
*   And Law No. 72 of 2020 regarding Competition Protection and its Executive Regulations,
*   And Ministerial Resolution No. (216) of 2014 regarding the Issuance of the Executive Regulations for Law No. (117) of 2013, which amended the provisions of Decree-Law No. (10) of 1979 regarding the Supervision of Trading in Goods and Handicrafts and the Determination of Prices for Some of Them, and its Amendments,
*   And based on what was presented by the Undersecretary of the Ministry,
*   And based on what the public interest dictates.

Has decided

**Article One**

All car rental companies, establishments, and offices must adhere to the following conditions, ensuring their inclusion in rental contracts:
1.  The lessor is obligated to deliver the vehicle in sound and safe technical condition, meeting all safety requirements, and equipped with necessary accessories such as emergency tools and spare tires.
2.  The condition of the vehicle must be documented before delivery through video or photographic recording and by noting observations in the contract, specifying any prior damages.
3.  The lessee is obligated to return the vehicle in the same condition as received, taking into account normal wear and tear. The lessee bears responsibility for all damages that fall outside the scope of the agent's warranty – if it is only under warranty – which may affect the vehicle during the rental period, including the cost of losing the car key or its registration document according to the agency's prices or competent authorities. In the event of any damages, the vehicle's affiliated agency's assessment is considered the approved reference for determining costs.
4.  The lessor is obligated to provide supplementary (comprehensive) insurance for the rented vehicle, with its terms clearly specified in the contract, including types of accidents, third-party damages, insurance policy number, expiry date, deductible amount, and file opening fees, while exempting the lessee from repair costs, losses due to market value depreciation, and any amounts incurred by the lessee during the repair period.
5.  The rental day is calculated as 24 hours starting from the time of vehicle collection, and the delay period is calculated either in hours or days.
6.  In the event of an accident, the lessee is obligated to provide a repair permit from the Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig>, bearing the insurance file opening fees and the percentage specified in the contract, while avoiding any repairs without written consent from the lessor. If the vehicle is impounded by authorities for reasons attributable to the lessee, the lessee shall bear the daily rental cost of the vehicle.
7.  The lessor is obligated to provide the lessee with a copy of the rental contract and any related documents, clearly outlining the rights and obligations of both parties without including any ambiguous clauses. The lessor is also prohibited from obligating the lessee to sign financial documents such as trust receipts or promissory notes.

**Article Two**

Without prejudice to any more severe penalty, the provisions of Article (13) of the aforementioned Decree-Law No. (10) of 1979 shall apply to the violator.

**Article Three**

All officials – each within their respective jurisdiction – shall implement this decision, which shall be effective from its date of issuance and published in the Official Gazette.

Minister of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزير التجارة والصناعة</orig>
Khalifa Abdullah Al-Ajeel <orig>خليفة عبد الله العجيل</orig>

Has decided

# Ministerial Resolution No. (233) of 2024
Regarding the Regulation of the Work of Exchange Companies and Establishments
in accordance with the requirements of the Central Bank of Kuwait <orig>بنك الكويت المركزي</orig>

## Minister of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزير التجارة والصناعة</orig>,

### Having reviewed:
- The Penal Code <orig>قانون الجزاء</orig> issued by Law No. (16) of 1960 and its amending laws,
- The Code of Criminal Procedures and Trials <orig>قانون الإجراءات والمحاكمات الجزائية</orig> issued by Law No. (17) of 1960 and its amending laws,
- Law No. (32) of 1968 concerning Currency, the Central Bank of Kuwait <orig>بنك الكويت المركزي</orig>, and the Regulation of the Banking Profession <orig>المهنة المصرفية</orig>, and its amendments,
- The Commercial Law <orig>قانون التجارة</orig> issued by Decree-Law No. (68) of 1980 and its amending laws,
- The Resolution of the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> regarding subjecting exchange companies <orig>شركات الصرافة</orig> to the supervision of the Central Bank of Kuwait <orig>بنك الكويت المركزي</orig>, issued on March 19, 1984,
- Law No. 93 of 2013 approving the Arab Convention for Combating Money Laundering and Terrorist Financing <orig>الاتفاقية العربية لمكافحة غسل الأموال وتمويل الإرهاب</orig>,
- Law No. (5) of 2006 approving the United Nations Convention against Transnational Organized Crime <orig>اتفاقية الأمم المتحدة لمكافحة الجريمة المنظمة عبر الوطنية</orig> and its two annexed protocols,
- Law No. (106) of 2013 concerning Combating Money Laundering and Terrorist Financing <orig>مكافحة غسل الأموال وتمويل الإرهاب</orig>, amended by Law No. 24 of 2016 AD,
- Ministerial Resolution No. 37 of 2013 issuing the Executive Regulations <orig>اللائحة التنفيذية</orig> for Law No. 106 of 2013 on Combating Money Laundering and Terrorist Financing <orig>مكافحة غسل الأموال وتمويل الإرهاب</orig>, and its amending ministerial resolutions,
- Law No. 111 of 2013 concerning Commercial Shop Licenses <orig>تراخيص المحلات التجارية</orig>,
- Ministerial Resolution No. 411 of 2013 on the Executive Regulations <orig>اللائحة التنفيذية</orig> for Law No. 111 of 2013 concerning Commercial Shop Licenses <orig>تراخيص المحلات التجارية</orig>, and its amending resolutions,
- Decree No. 191 of 2015 concerning the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>,
- Law No. 1 of 2016 issuing the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig> and its amending laws,
- Resolution of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> No. 287 of 2016 issuing the Executive Regulations <orig>اللائحة التنفيذية</orig> for Law No. 1 of 2016 issuing the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig>, and its amending resolutions,
- Decree No. 73 of 2024 forming the Cabinet <orig>تشكيل الوزارة</orig> and its amending decrees,
- And on the letter from the Central Bank of Kuwait <orig>بنك الكويت المركزي</orig> No. (2014/070296) dated 15/8/2024 concerning the implementation of specific instructions and procedures for exchange companies and establishments <orig>شركات ومؤسسات الصرافة</orig>.
- And on the letter from the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> No. 805 dated 3/12/2024 AD,
- And on what was presented by the Undersecretary of the Ministry <orig>وكيل الوزارة</orig>,
- And based on what the public interest <orig>المصلحة العامة</orig> dictates.
- And pursuant to the powers vested in us.

Has decided

### Article One
Exchange companies and establishments <orig>شركات ومؤسسات الصرافة</orig> subject to the supervision of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>, which engage in the activity of selling, buying, or exchanging foreign currency banknotes or providing money transfer services <orig>خدمات تحويل الأموال</orig> for clients, shall adhere to the following:
1. Submit an application to the Central Bank of Kuwait <orig>بنك الكويت المركزي</orig> through the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> to obtain preliminary approval <orig>موافقة مبدئية</orig> to engage in money transfer activity <orig>نشاط تحويل الأموال</orig>, including an undertaking to comply with the requirements specified by the Central Bank of Kuwait <orig>بنك الكويت المركزي</orig> for performing the requested service.
2. Fulfill the conditions and requirements set by the Central Bank of Kuwait <orig>بنك الكويت المركزي</orig> within a specified period from the date of preliminary approval <orig>الموافقة المبدئية</orig>.
3. Refrain from performing the requested service before the issuance of final approval <orig>الموافقة النهائية</orig> from the Central Bank of Kuwait <orig>بنك الكويت المركزي</orig> and the completion of registration procedures in the bank's register of exchange companies <orig>سجل شركات الصرافة</orig>.

### Article Two
Existing licenses for exchange companies and establishments <orig>شركات ومؤسسات الصرافة</orig> shall be granted a grace period to regularize their status <orig>توفيق أوضاعها</orig> in accordance with the requirements of the Central Bank of Kuwait <orig>بنك الكويت المركزي</orig>, ending on 31/3/2025 AD.

### Article Three
All commercial activities and licenses, including exchange establishments <orig>مؤسسات الصرافة</orig>, are prohibited from providing alternative remittance services <orig>خدمات الحوالات البديلة</orig> as of 31/3/2025 AD.

### Article Four
The issuance of new licenses for exchange establishments or companies <orig>مؤسسات أو شركات الصرافة</orig> shall be suspended, and the licenses of establishments or companies that have not regularized their status <orig>توفيق أوضاعها</orig> in accordance with the requirements of the Central Bank of Kuwait <orig>بنك الكويت المركزي</orig> shall be suspended or revoked.

### Article Five
This Resolution shall be effective from the date of its issuance, shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>, and all concerned parties <orig>الجهات المعنية</orig> shall be obligated to comply with and implement it.

# Ministerial Resolution No. (234) of 2024 AD
## Regarding the Cessation of Using the Paper Broker's Ledger

Minister of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزير التجارة والصناعة</orig>,
Having reviewed:
* Decree-Law No. (68) of 1980 issuing the Commercial Law <orig>قانون التجارة</orig> and its amending laws;
* Law No. (32) of 1982 regarding the Civil Information System <orig>نظام المعلومات المدنية</orig>;
* Law No. (20) of 2014 regarding Electronic Transactions <orig>المعاملات الإلكترونية</orig>;
* Decree No. (191) of 2015 regarding the Organization of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>;
* Law No. (1) of 2016 issuing the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig> and its amending laws;
* Law No. (33) of 2016 regarding Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig>, amended by Law No. (1) of 2018;
* Ministerial Resolution No. (164) of 2020 regarding the Regulation of Real Estate Brokerage Profession <orig>مهنة السمسرة العقارية</orig> and its amending resolutions;
* Ministerial Resolution No. (97) of 2022 establishing the Electronic Real Estate Broker's Ledger <orig>دفتر الوسيط العقاري الإلكتروني</orig> and its amending resolutions;
* What was presented by the Undersecretary of the Ministry <orig>وكيل الوزارة</orig>;
* And based on the requirements of the public interest;

Has resolved

Article One
The use of the paper broker's ledger <orig>دفتر السمسار الورقي</orig> shall cease as of 1/1/2025, with all real estate brokers <orig>الوسطاء العقاريين</orig> being obligated to use the electronic real estate broker's ledger <orig>دفتر الوسيط العقاري الإلكتروني</orig> in accordance with the resolutions regulating it.

Article Two
All resolutions or texts that contradict the provisions of this resolution shall be repealed.

Article Three
Officials – each within their jurisdiction – shall implement this resolution, which shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> and shall be effective from the date of its publication.

Minister of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزير التجارة والصناعة</orig>
Khalifa Abdullah Al-Ajeel <orig>خليفة عبد الله العجيل</orig>

## Provision, Supply, Installation, Operation, and Warranty of Hyper-Converged Virtual Environment Systems

The Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> announces a practice tender: (D.A/M/779) Provision, supply, installation, operation, and warranty of hyper-converged virtual environment systems.
Companies or specialized establishments wishing to participate in this field should apply to obtain the terms and conditions booklet and practice documents during official working hours from (Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> - Bayan Palace <orig>قصر بيان</orig> - Administrative Building - First Floor - Zone 7 - Tenders and Follow-up Department) during official working hours, for a non-refundable fee of (75 K.D.) seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only (K-Net payment only) for the booklet. Owners of small and medium-sized enterprises are exempt from these fees (upon submission of a supporting certificate), starting from Sunday, 15/12/2024, from 8:30 AM until 1:30 PM, taking into account the following:
1- The deadline for submitting bids is 1:30 PM on Thursday, 26/12/2024. No bids will be accepted after this time.
2- Bids must be submitted in a sealed envelope to the Tenders and Follow-up Department - Bayan Palace <orig>قصر بيان</orig> - Administrative Building - First Floor - Zone 7.
3- Submission of an initial security deposit of 2% of the bid value in favor of the Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> in the form of a letter of guarantee or a certified check from one of the Kuwaiti banks, valid throughout the bid validity period of (90) days.
4- Submission of a valid national labor percentage compliance certificate and a valid tax compliance certificate.
5- A letter of authorization and a copy of the civil ID for the company's representative to purchase the practice document.
6- This practice is indivisible, and alternative offers are not permitted.
7- The practitioner must submit a letter accompanied by a copy of the registration certificate with the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig>.
The preliminary meeting is scheduled for Monday, 22/12/2024, at 10:00 AM.
The bid must remain valid for a period of (90) days from the closing date, with the Amiri Diwan <orig>الديوان الأميري</orig> reserving the right to extend or renew this period for such duration(s) as it deems appropriate to complete the award procedures.
For inquiries, please call the following numbers:
- Direct: 22011437 - 22011423 - 22011426

Decree No. (12) of 2024
Regarding the amendment of some provisions of Decree No. (15) of 1979
Concerning the Civil Service System
Having reviewed the Constitution,
And Decree-Law No. (15) of 1979 concerning the Civil Service System and its amendments,
And Decree No. (12) of 2024 amending some provisions of the aforementioned Decree No. (15) of 1979,
And based on the submission of the Prime Minister <orig>رئيس مجلس الوزراء</orig>,
And after the approval of the Council of Ministers <orig>مجلس الوزراء</orig>,
We have decreed the following:

<table>
| Article | Original Text | Amended Text |
|---|---|---|
| 1 | Employees shall be appointed to vacant positions. | Employees shall be appointed to vacant positions in accordance with the provisions of this Decree. |
| 2 | The executive regulations shall specify the conditions for appointment. | The executive regulations shall specify the conditions and controls for appointment. |
</table>

Article (1)
The text of Article (1) of the aforementioned Decree No. (15) of 1979 shall be replaced with the following text:
"Employees shall be appointed to vacant positions in accordance with the provisions of this Decree."
Article (2)
The text of Article (2) of the aforementioned Decree No. (15) of 1979 shall be replaced with the following text:
"The executive regulations shall specify the conditions and controls for appointment."
Article (3)
The Prime Minister <orig>رئيس مجلس الوزراء</orig> and the Ministers – each within their respective jurisdiction – shall implement this Decree, and it shall come into force from the date of its publication in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.
Issued at Seif Palace <orig>قصر السيف</orig> on: 10 Sha'ban 1445 AH <orig>10 شعبان 1445 هـ</orig>
Corresponding to: 20 February 2024 AD <orig>20 فبراير 2024 م</orig>

# Al-Fihris Commercial Company <orig>شركة الفهرس التجارية</orig>
## Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting
On Wednesday, 2024/11/27, at 10:00 AM, the Extraordinary General Assembly of the shareholders of Al-Fihris Commercial Company <orig>شركة الفهرس التجارية</orig> held its meeting at the company's headquarters located in Fahaheel <orig>الفحيحيل</orig>, Block 11, Makkah Street <orig>شارع مكة</orig> – Qais Al-Ghanim Complex <orig>مجمع قيس الغانم</orig> – First Floor, Office 128, chaired by Mr. Giancarlo Barolo <orig>جيانكارلو بارولو</orig>, Vice Chairman of the Board of Directors. Shareholders representing 72,000,000 shares attended the meeting, which constitutes 72,000,000 shares of the company's total shares, amounting to 100%.

Mr. Giancarlo Barolo <orig>جيانكارلو بارولو</orig>, Vice Chairman of the Board of Directors, opened the meeting. After discussing the agenda items, the following decisions were made and approved:
1- Amendment of Article No. (68) of the Articles of Association:
Article Before Amendment
e. Annually, by a resolution issued by the Ordinary General Assembly based on a proposal from the Board of Directors, a percentage not exceeding ten percent of the net profits may be deducted to form an optional reserve allocated for purposes determined by the Assembly.
f. The General Assembly, based on a proposal from the Board of Directors, may distribute dividends to shareholders at the end of the fiscal year. The validity of this distribution is conditional on it being from real profits, in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles, and that this distribution does not affect the company's paid-up capital.

Article After Amendment
a. Annually, by a resolution issued by the Ordinary General Assembly based on a proposal from the Board of Directors, a percentage of not less than ten percent of the net profits shall be deducted to form a statutory reserve for the company.
The Assembly may waive this deduction if the statutory reserve exceeds half of the company's issued capital.
The statutory reserve may only be used to cover company losses or to ensure the distribution of dividends to shareholders at a rate not exceeding five percent of the paid-up capital in years when the company's profits do not allow for the distribution of this percentage, due to the absence of an optional reserve that permits the distribution of this percentage of profits.
What has been deducted from the statutory reserve must be returned to it when the profits of subsequent years allow, unless this reserve exceeds half of the issued capital.
b. A percentage of 1% (one percent) shall be deducted and allocated to the account of the Kuwait Foundation for the Advancement of Sciences <orig>مؤسسة الكويت للتقدم العلمي</orig>.
c. Annually, a percentage shall be deducted from the gross profits, determined by the Board of Directors after consulting the auditor, for the depreciation of the company's assets or to compensate for their decrease in value. These funds shall be used to purchase necessary materials, machinery, and facilities or to repair them, and these funds may not be distributed to shareholders.
d. The Ordinary General Assembly must decide to deduct a percentage of the profits to meet the company's obligations under labor and social insurance laws, and a special fund may be established to assist the company's workers and employees.
e. Annually, by a resolution issued by the Ordinary General Assembly based on a proposal from the Board of Directors, a percentage not exceeding ten percent of the net profits may be deducted to form an optional reserve allocated for purposes determined by the Assembly.
f. The Board of Directors is authorized to distribute dividends to the company's shareholders on a quarterly or semi-annual basis as deemed appropriate during the fiscal year, provided that the distribution is from real profits and in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles without prejudice to the paid-up capital. The Board of Directors is also authorized to adjust the dividend entitlement date if the requirements cannot be met.

Subject to the provisions contained in the company's articles of association, the General Assembly, based on a proposal from the Board of Directors, may distribute dividends to shareholders at the end of the fiscal year or each financial period. The validity of this distribution is conditional on it being from real profits, in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles, and that this distribution does not affect the company's paid-up capital.
The meeting concluded at 11:00 AM.

Vice Chairman of the Board of Directors

## Kuwaiti Jordanian Holding Company <orig>شركة الكويتية الاردنية القابضة</orig>
### Minutes of the Adjourned Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting held on 05/12/2024

The Extraordinary Adjourned General Assembly of the shareholders of Kuwaiti Jordanian Holding Company K.S.C.C. (under liquidation) <orig>الشركة الكويتية الاردنية القابضة ش.م.ك.م (تحت التصفية)</orig> was held at 1:30 PM on Thursday, 05/12/2024, at Al-Khaleejia Complex <orig>مجمع الخليجية</orig>, Sharq <orig>الشرق</orig> area, meeting room on the seventh floor. The meeting was chaired by Mr. Saud Ahmed Al-Hassan <orig>سعود أحمد الحسن</orig> – Chairman of the Liquidation Committee, and attended by the representative of Al-Khaleejia Company for Securities Custody <orig>الشركة الخليجية لحفظ الأوراق المالية</orig>, Mr. Omar Osama Al-Zawawi <orig>عمر أسامة الزواوي</orig>, and the representative of the auditor, Mr. Yousef Al-Awadhi <orig>يوسف العوضي</orig> from Al-Aiban & Al-Osaimi & Partners (Ernst & Young) <orig>مكتب العيبان والعصيمي وشركاه أرنست أند يونغ</orig>, and a representative member from the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>. This meeting was held after the quorum was not met on the originally scheduled date of 28/11/2024.
After the representative of Al-Khaleejia Company for Securities Custody <orig>الشركة الخليجية لحفظ الأوراق المالية</orig> confirmed the completion of the legal quorum for the validity of the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting, with the attendance of 15,306,000 shares, representing 72.8857% of the total capital shares amounting to 21,000,000 shares, the Chairman of the General Assembly welcomed the attendees and commenced the meeting as follows:
1- The registration of the liquidation period for one year was approved.

## BNK Holding Company <orig>شركة بي إن كي القابضة</orig>
### Minutes of the Extraordinary General Assembly Meeting held on Wednesday, 20/11/2024

The Extraordinary General Assembly of the shareholders of BNK Holding Company <orig>شركة بي إن كي القابضة</orig> held its meeting at 11:30 AM on Wednesday, 20/11/2024, at the company's headquarters located east of Al Hamra Tower <orig>برج الحمرا</orig> – Business Center, 69th Floor.
The meeting was chaired by Mr. Khalid Abdullah Al-Mulla <orig>خالد عبدالله الملا</orig> – Chairman of the Board of Directors. The following also attended the meeting:
- The company's external auditor, represented by Dr. Rashid Al-Qana'i <orig>رشيد القناعي</orig> from KPMG Al-Qana'i & Partners <orig>مكتب كي إم جي القناعي وشركاه</orig>
- Shareholders holding 100,000 shares, in person and by proxy, representing 100% of the total capital shares amounting to 100,000 shares.
After the announcement of the availability of the legal quorum for the validity of the Extraordinary General Assembly meeting, Mr. Khalid Abdullah Al-Mulla <orig>خالد عبدالله الملا</orig> opened the meeting, welcoming the attendees, and then proceeded to present the items on the agenda of the Ordinary General Assembly for discussion, and the following took place:

### Item One:
The Board of Directors' recommendation to increase the company's authorized, issued, and paid-up capital from K.D. 10,000 to K.D. 50,000,000, an increase of K.D. 49,990,000, was approved. This increase will be effected by distributing free bonus shares at a rate of 499,900% to shareholders registered in the company's records until the date of the General Assembly meeting, making the capital K.D. 50,000,000 (fifty million Kuwaiti Dinars). The value of this increase will be covered from retained earnings. The Board of Directors is authorized to set the controls and conditions for calling up the capital and disposing of fractional shares, if any. Approved 100%.

### Item Two:
The amendment of Article No. (8) of the Memorandum of Incorporation and Article No. (5) of the Articles of Association was approved as follows:

5- The fee for obtaining a copy of the practice (tender) documents is (75 Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً كويتياً</orig>).
6- The bid must be accompanied by an initial security deposit of no less than (2000 K.D.) two thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only, representing the bid value. 4- This practice is (indivisible), and the tenderer is not entitled to submit alternative offers unless the documents explicitly state so.

# Notice

Regarding the extension of the closing date for Practice No. (L.A. 2023/163, 2024) for the repair, maintenance, supply, installation, and warranty of necessary consumable spare parts for (1) medium-sized hovercraft (H22 8100 TD), along with the supply and warranty of necessary consumable spare parts for (5) small-sized hovercrafts (H1 470TD, H2, H3, H4, H5) with special specifications for the General Department of Coast Guard <orig>الإدارة العامة لخفر السواحل</orig> at the Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig>.

Please be informed that the closing date (submission of bids) for the aforementioned practice has been extended to Monday, 23/12/2024, at the Bid Opening Committee <orig>لجنة فض المظاريف</orig> in the Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig> building (Sharq Area <orig>منطقة شرق</orig>, Al-Siddiq School <orig>مدرسة الصديق</orig>, First Floor), from 8:00 AM until 1:00 PM. No bids submitted before or after the specified time will be accepted.

# Announcement

The Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig> announces Practice No. (L.Sh. 2024/164-2025) for the supply of various materials for the general force, for the Stores Department <orig>إدارة المخازن</orig> of the General Department of Supply and Logistics <orig>الإدارة العامة للإمداد والتموين</orig> at the Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig>.

Specialized companies/establishments in this field are requested to refer to the General Department of Financial Affairs <orig>الإدارة العامة للشئون المالية</orig> – Tenders Department <orig>إدارة المناقصات</orig> (in Al-Ardiya Industrial Area <orig>العارضية الصناعية</orig>) to obtain the documents for this practice for a non-refundable fee of (20/-) K.D. (Kuwaiti Dinars) <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only, payable via K-Net. An initial guarantee (to be attached to the financial bid for the practice) must be submitted for each item separately as follows:
- Item No. (1): (400/-) Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>.
- Item No. (2): (450/-) Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>.
- Item No. (3): (700/-) Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>.
- Item No. (4): (250/-) Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>.
- Item No. (5): (100/-) Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>.

Please note that the final insurance for the practice is (10%) of the total contract value.

Applicants must bring a copy of the practice announcement from the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>), and the following documents:
- Valid registration receipt with the Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig>. Or
- A registration request for registration with the Ministry, followed by the purchase of practice documents. Please note that the closing date (submission of bids) is Wednesday, 22/01/2025, from 8:00 AM until 1:00 PM. No bids submitted before or after the specified time will be accepted. Bids must be submitted to the Bid Opening Committee <orig>لجنة فض المظاريف</orig> of the Purchasing Committee <orig>لجنة الشراء</orig> at the Ministry of Interior <orig>وزارة الداخلية</orig> building (Sharq Area <orig>منطقة شرق</orig> – Al-Siddiq School <orig>مدرسة الصديق</orig> – First Floor).

### Minutes of the Meeting of the Births and Deaths Committee <orig>لجنة المواليد والوفيات</orig> held on 2024/11/19

The Births and Deaths Committee <orig>لجنة المواليد والوفيات</orig>, stipulated in Article 15 of Law No. 36/69 and formed by Ministerial Resolution No. 1650/2021, met.

*   Mr. / Director of the Central Registry Department for Births and Deaths <orig>إدارة السجل المركزي للمواليد والوفيات</orig> - Chairman
*   Ms. / Head of the Research and Opinion Section <orig>قسم البحوث والرأي</orig> - Member
*   Mr. / Head of the Deaths Section <orig>قسم الوفيات</orig> - Member
*   Mr. / Head of the Records Section <orig>قسم السجلات</orig> - Member

Ms. Shukriya Al-Darba'i <orig>شكرية الدربعي</orig> acted as the Committee's secretary.
The Committee reviewed requests from No. ((722)) to No. ((736)) in the attached list concerning the amendment of data in birth and death records for unregistered birth and death applications. After reviewing and verifying the completeness of the documents and supporting papers, the Committee decided to announce the amendments and requests in the Official Gazette (Kuwait Today / Al-Kuwait Al-Youm <orig>الكويت اليوم</orig>) in two consecutive issues. If, after the legal period of (fifteen days) from the date of the last announcement, no objection is submitted, the amendments will be made in the registers, and birth and death certificates will be issued.

### Minutes of the Meeting of the Births and Deaths Committee in its Session No. 2024/41 held on 2024/11/26

** According to the description certificate:

- The disputed property located in Rumaithiya <orig>الرميثية</orig> area – block 2 – street 24 – house 118 – automated number 11739791, and the inspection was carried out as follows:

- Air conditioning: units.

## Second: Auction Terms:
- First: The auction shall start at the base price, and participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
- Second: Whoever's bid is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees at the time of the sale session.
- Third: If the bidder whose bid was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price, otherwise the bidding will be reopened at their expense in the same session based on the price at which the sale was concluded.
- Fourth: If the bidder deposits the price in the next session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full price. In this case, the bidding shall be reopened in the same session based on this price.
- Fifth: If the first bidder does not deposit the full price in the next session and no one comes forward to bid with an increase, the bidding shall be immediately reopened at their expense based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session, and no bid in this session shall be considered unless accompanied by the deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.
- Sixth: In all cases, the successful bidder shall bear the transfer and registration fees for ownership, the expenses of enforcement procedures amounting to K.D. 200, legal and expert fees, and the costs of advertising and publishing the sale in daily newspapers.
- Seventh: This announcement is published in application of the law, and those directly involved in the sale procedures are responsible for it, without the Clerk's Office <orig>إدارة الكتاب</orig> of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig> bearing any responsibility.
- Eighth: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property with an inspection that negates ignorance.

### Notice:
1- This sale announcement shall be published in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig> in accordance with Article 266 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
2- The auction award judgment is appealable within seven days from the date of its pronouncement, in accordance with Article 277 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig>.
3- The last paragraph of Article 276 of the Code of Civil Procedure <orig>قانون المرافعات</orig> states that "If the person whose property has been expropriated is residing in the property, they shall remain in it as a tenant by force of law, and the successful bidder shall be obligated to draw up a lease contract in their favor at a fair market rent."

President of the General Court <orig>المحكمة الكلية</orig>

## Second: Auction Terms and Conditions:
*   **First**: The auction shall commence at the basic price associated with the property. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
*   **Second**: The bidder whose offer is approved by the judge must deposit, at the time of the sale session, the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees.
*   **Third**: If the bidder whose offer was approved does not deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price, and the bidding shall not be reopened on their account in the same session based on the price at which the sale was concluded.
*   **Fourth**: In the event that the bidder whose offer was approved deposits at least one-fifth of the price, the sale shall be postponed with a ten percent increase.
*   **Fifth**: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless someone comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by the deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding shall be reopened in the same session based on this price.
*   **Sixth**: If the initial bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session, and no one comes forward to bid with the ten percent increase, the bidding shall immediately be reopened on their account based on the price at which it was awarded to them in the previous session. No offer in this session shall be considered valid unless accompanied by a deposit of its full value. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.

Second: Auction Terms and Conditions:
First: The auction shall commence at the base price specified for the property. Participation in the auction requires payment of at least one-fifth of that price by a certified check from the drawee bank or by a letter of guarantee from one of the banks in favor of the Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> at the Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig>.
Second: The bidder whose offer is approved by the judge must deposit the full approved price, expenses, and registration fees at the time of the sale session.
Third: If the bidder whose offer was approved fails to deposit the full price, they must deposit at least one-fifth of the price; otherwise, the bidding will be reopened at their expense in the same session, based on the price at which the sale was previously concluded.
Fourth: If the bidder whose offer was approved deposits at least one-fifth of the price, the sale shall be postponed with a ten percent increase.
Fifth: If the bidder deposits the price in the subsequent session, the auction shall be awarded to them, unless another party comes forward in that session willing to purchase with a ten percent increase, accompanied by a deposit of the full auction price. In this case, the bidding shall be reopened in the same session based on this new price.
Sixth: If the initial bidder fails to deposit the full price in the subsequent session, and no one comes forward to bid with the ten percent increase, the bidding shall immediately be reopened at their expense based on the price at which it was previously awarded to them in the preceding session. In this session, no offer not accompanied by a full deposit of its value shall be considered. The defaulting bidder shall be liable for any shortfall in the property's price.

Ninth: The successful bidder acknowledges that they have inspected the property in a manner that negates any ignorance of its condition.

## Announcement of the Sale of Seized Items by Public Auction

The Ministry of Justice <orig>وزارة العدل</orig> – Capital Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة تنفيذ العاصمة</orig> announces that on Wednesday,
2025/01/22, starting from 10:30 AM, seized items will be sold by public auction at its headquarters located in the Western Industrial Sector <orig>الشعبة الصناعية الغربية</orig> – Block 5 – Street 1 – Plot 63. The seized items belong to the defendant /
High Slant Group Contracting Company <orig>شركة مجموعة هاي سلانت للمقاولات</orig>, and are detailed in the executive
seizure report dated 2024/11/26, File No. 200473400,
which were seized in favor of the claimant / United Construction Company (ESCO) <orig>شركة الإنشاءات المتحدة (اسكو)</orig>, for the amount of 16,536.250 K.D. <orig>د.ك.</orig>
Those wishing to purchase should attend at the time and place specified above.
For those who wish to view any further details, they should refer to the Compulsory Enforcement Section <orig>قسم التنفيذ الجبري</orig> – Enforcement Department <orig>إدارة التنفيذ</orig> during official working hours. This statement is hereby announced.

Enforcement Officer <orig>مأمور التنفيذ</orig>
Head of the Capital Enforcement Department <orig>رئيس إدارة تنفيذ العاصمة</orig>

They also acknowledge their commitment to all established rules for the company's incorporation in accordance with the provisions of the following articles:
The preceding preamble is considered an integral part of this contract.
The founders acknowledge that the company was established in accordance with the provisions of Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 1 لسنة 2016</orig> and its amendments and executive regulations, and the provisions of this contract. The company shall enjoy legal personality from the date of registration, and may not commence its activities except from the date of registration and the approval of all regulatory authorities for its engagement in the activity.

### Article (1)
Company Name / Trolley General Trading Company <orig>شركة ترولي للتجارة العامة</orig>.
And its trade name - a Kuwaiti Closed Shareholding Company <orig>شركة مساهمة كويتية مقفلة</orig>.

### Article (2)
The company's head office is located in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> and its domicile is in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>. The partners may transfer the head office to any other location within Kuwait and open branches and agencies for the company inside and outside the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig>. The company may conduct the aforementioned business in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> and abroad, either principally or by agency. The company may also engage in similar, complementary, necessary, or related activities to its stated purposes.
The company's headquarters shall be considered its legal domicile for the purpose of directing correspondence and judicial notices to it.
Its details shall be recorded in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig>, and no amendment to this contract shall be effective until it is registered in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig>.

### Article (3)
The company's duration is unlimited.

### Article (4)
Without prejudice to the provisions of Decree-Law No. 1/2016 <orig>المرسوم بقانون الشركات رقم 2016/1</orig> concerning companies and its amendments - and its executive regulations, the purposes for which the company was established are:
1) Central markets for foodstuffs
2) Central markets for non-foodstuffs
3) Export and Import Office
The company may conduct the aforementioned business in the State of Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> and abroad, either principally or by agency. The company may also engage in similar, complementary, necessary, or related activities to its stated purposes. The company may have an interest in or participate in any way with bodies and companies that engage in activities similar to its own or that may assist it in achieving its purposes in Kuwait or abroad, and it may establish, participate in, acquire, or affiliate with such bodies or companies.

### Article (5)
The company's financial year begins on the first of (January) and ends on the last of (December) of each year, with the exception of the first financial year, which begins from the date of registration

### Article (4)
The authorized capital is set at KWD 2,000,000 (Two Million Kuwaiti Dinars), the issued capital at KWD 2,000,000 (Two Million Kuwaiti Dinars), and the paid-up capital at KWD 2,000,000 (Two Million Kuwaiti Dinars). The company's issued capital consists of cash shares distributed as follows:
KWD 2,000,000 (Two Million Kuwaiti Dinars) in cash.

### Article (5)
The duration of this company is unlimited.

### Article (6)
The company's shares are nominal (may be owned) by non-Kuwaitis in accordance with the provisions of the law and the ministerial resolutions regulating thereof.

### Article (7)
The authorized capital may not be increased unless the value of the original shares has been fully paid. The Extraordinary General Assembly may authorize the Board of Directors to determine the date of its implementation. Furthermore, the issued capital may be increased by a resolution of the company's Board of Directors within the limits of the authorized capital, provided that the issued capital has been fully paid.
New shares may not be issued at a value less than their nominal value.

### Article (8)
If the value of the original shares has been fully paid, the company's authorized capital may be increased by a resolution issued by the Extraordinary General Assembly after obtaining the approval of the regulatory authorities, based on a reasoned proposal from the Board of Directors and a report from the auditor in this regard, provided that the resolution issued for the capital increase specifies the amount and methods of the increase.

In all cases where the new shares are not fully subscribed, the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may allocate the unsubscribed shares to new shareholders. The unsubscribed new shares shall be deemed cancelled by operation of law.

### Article (10)
The Company may increase its capital through public subscription <orig>الاكتتاب العام</orig> as stipulated in Article (160) of Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 1 لسنة 2016</orig>, its amendments, and its executive regulations.

## Subscription
### Article (11)
The founders <orig>المؤسسون</orig> who signed the Articles of Association <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig> subscribed to the entire capital of the Company with 20,000,000 (twenty million shares) with a nominal value of K.D. 2,000,000 (two million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>), distributed among them in proportion to their subscription as specified in the Articles of Association <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig>.

### Article (12)
Ownership of a share necessarily entails the shareholders' acceptance of the Articles of Association <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig>, the provisions of the Company's Articles of Incorporation <orig>النظام الأساسي</orig>, and the resolutions of its General Assemblies <orig>جمعياتها العامة</orig>.

### Article (13)
Subject to the provisions of the law, regulatory requirements, and any privileges and rights that this Statute <orig>النظام</orig> may stipulate for certain types of shares, each share entitles its owner to an equal share without discrimination in the ownership of the Company's assets and in the distributed profits.

### Article (14)
The Company shall have a special register <orig>سجل خاص</orig> kept by a clearing agency <orig>وكالة مقاصة</orig>, in which the names of shareholders, their nationalities, domiciles, the number and type of shares owned by them, and the value paid for each share shall be recorded.
Any changes occurring to the data recorded in the shareholders' register <orig>سجل المساهمين</orig> shall be endorsed in accordance with the information received by the Company or the clearing agency <orig>وكالة المقاصة</orig>. Any interested party may request the Company or the clearing agency <orig>وكالة المقاصة</orig> to provide them with the data from this register.

### Article (15)
## Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig>:
Within three months from the date of subscription <orig>الاكتتاب</orig> and before the meeting of the Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig>, the founders <orig>المؤسسون</orig> must submit to the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> a statement detailing the number of subscribed shares, a list of subscribers who have paid the required installments, the names and addresses of subscribers, the number of shares subscribed by each, the value of the share, and the amount paid thereof.

### Article (16)
The founders <orig>المؤسسون</orig> must invite the Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> to convene within three months from the date of completion of the subscription <orig>الاكتتاب</orig>. If this period expires without the Assembly being held, the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> shall, within fifteen days from the expiry date, invite the Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> to convene.

### Article (17)
The invitation to attend the meeting of the Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig>, including the agenda, time, and place of the meeting, shall be sent by one of the following methods:
1- Registered letters sent to all subscribers at least two weeks before the scheduled date of the meeting.
2- Advertisement, which must be published twice, with the second advertisement published no less than seven days after the date of the first advertisement and at least seven days before the meeting.
3- Hand delivery to shareholders or their legal representatives at least one day before the meeting, with an endorsement on a copy of the invitation confirming receipt.
4- Any other modern communication means specified in the executive regulations of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig>. The Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> must be notified in writing of the agenda, date, and place of the meeting at least seven days before its convening for its representative to attend.
The meeting of the Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> shall be chaired by the person elected by the Assembly for this purpose.

### Article (18)
The meeting of the Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> shall not be valid unless attended by shareholders entitled to vote, representing more than half of the subscribed shares.
If this quorum is not met, the Assembly must be invited to a second meeting with the same agenda, to be held within a period of no less than seven days and no more than thirty days from the date of the first meeting. The second meeting shall be valid regardless of the number of attendees.
A new invitation for the second meeting may not be required if its date was specified in the invitation to the first meeting. Resolutions shall be issued by an absolute majority of the shares present at the meeting.

### Article (19)
The founders <orig>المؤسسون</orig> shall submit to the Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> a report containing comprehensive information on all incorporation procedures and the amounts expended, along with supporting documents. This report shall be placed in a location designated by the founders <orig>المؤسسون</orig> for subscribers to review, at least seven days before the Assembly meeting, and this shall be indicated in the invitation to subscribers to attend the meeting.

### Article (20)
The Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> shall be competent to address the following matters:
1- Approving the Company's incorporation procedures after verifying their validity and conformity with the provisions of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig> and the Company's Articles of Association <orig>عقد الشركة</orig>.
2- Approving the valuation of in-kind contributions <orig>الحصص العينية</orig>, if any, as stipulated in Article (11) of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig>.
3- Electing the members of the first Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>.
4- Appointing the auditor <orig>مراقب الحسابات</orig> and determining their fees.
5- Declaring the final incorporation of the Company.
A copy of the minutes of the Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> meeting shall be sent to the Ministry of Commerce <orig>وزارة التجارة</orig>.

The first Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة الأول</orig> shall publish the company's articles of association <orig>عقد الشركة</orig> and register it in the Commercial Register <orig>السجل التجاري</orig> within thirty days from the date of the final announcement of the company's establishment.

### Article (21)
Rights and Obligations of Shareholders:
A shareholder <orig>المساهم</orig> in the company shall, in particular, enjoy the following rights:
1. Receiving dividends <orig>الأرباح</orig> and obtaining bonus shares <orig>أسهم المنحة</orig> that are decided for distribution.
2. Participating in the company's management through membership in the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, attending General Assemblies <orig>الجمعيات العامة</orig>, and participating in their deliberations, in accordance with the provisions of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig> and these Articles of Association <orig>النظام</orig>. Any agreement to the contrary shall be null and void.
3. Obtaining, at least seven days before the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> meeting, the company's financial statements <orig>البيانات المالية</orig> for the expired accounting period <orig>الفترة المحاسبية</orig>, the Board of Directors' report <orig>تقرير مجلس الإدارة</orig>, and the auditor's report <orig>تقرير مراقب الحسابات</orig>.
4. Disposing of his owned shares <orig>الأسهم المملوكة له</orig> and priority in subscribing to new shares <orig>الأسهم الجديدة</orig>.
5. Obtaining a share of the company's assets <orig>موجودات الشركة</orig> upon liquidation <orig>التصفية</orig> after settling its debts <orig>ديون</orig>.

### Article (22)
A shareholder <orig>المساهم</orig> in the company shall, in particular, be obligated to:
1. Paying the installments <orig>الأقساط</orig> due on his shares <orig>أسهم</orig> upon their due dates <orig>مواعيد الاستحقاق</orig> and paying compensation for delay in payment.
2. Paying the expenses <orig>النفقات</orig> incurred by the company to collect unpaid installments <orig>الأقساط غير المدفوعة</orig> on the value of his shares. The company may execute on the shares <orig>التنفيذ على الأسهم</orig> to satisfy its rights.
3. Implementing the resolutions issued by the company's General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>.
4. Refraining from any act that harms the financial or moral interests <orig>المصالح المالية أو الأدبية</orig> of the company and being obligated to compensate for damages arising from such violation.

### Article (23)
The General Assembly of Shareholders <orig>الجمعية العامة للمساهمين</orig> may not do the following:
1. Increasing the shareholder's financial burdens <orig>أعباء المساهم المالية</orig> or increasing the nominal value of the share <orig>قيمة السهم الاسمية</orig>.
2. Decreasing the percentage of net profits <orig>الأرباح الصافية</orig> to be distributed to shareholders, as specified in the company's articles of association <orig>عقد الشركة</orig>.
3. Imposing new conditions <orig>شروط جديد</orig> not stipulated in the articles of incorporation <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig> or these Articles of Association <orig>النظام</orig> regarding the shareholder's right to attend and vote at General Assemblies <orig>الجمعيات العامة</orig>.
These provisions may be deviated from with the written consent of all shareholders <orig>جميع المساهمين</orig> or by a unanimous vote <orig>تصويت إجماعي</orig> involving all shareholders, and by completing the necessary procedures to amend the company's articles of association <orig>عقد الشركة</orig>.

### Article (24)
1- Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>:
The company shall be managed by a Board of Directors <orig>مجلس إدارة</orig> consisting of (5) members. The term of membership shall be three years, renewable.
If it is not possible to elect a new Board of Directors <orig>مجلس إدارة جديد</orig> within the specified period, the existing Board <orig>المجلس القادم</orig> shall continue to manage the company's affairs until the reasons cease to exist and a new Board of Directors is elected.

### Article (25)
Shareholders <orig>المساهمون</orig> shall elect the members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> by secret ballot <orig>التصويت السري</orig>. The company's articles of association <orig>عقد الشركة</orig> may stipulate that a number not exceeding half of the members of the first Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة الأول</orig> be elected from among the company's founders <orig>مؤسسي الشركة</orig>.

### Article (26)
The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall elect, by secret ballot <orig>الاقتراع السري</orig>, a Chairman <orig>رئيساً للمجلس</orig> and a Vice-Chairman <orig>نائباً للرئيس</orig>. The Chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall represent the company in its relations with third parties <orig>الغير</orig> and before the judiciary <orig>القضاء</orig>, in addition to other powers specified in the articles of association <orig>العقد</orig>. His signature shall be considered as the signature of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> in the company's relations with third parties. He shall implement the Board's resolutions. The Vice-Chairman <orig>نائب الرئيس</orig> shall act in place of the Chairman <orig>الرئيس</orig> in his absence or if he is prevented from exercising his powers.

### Article (27)
The company may have a Chief Executive Officer <orig>رئيساً تنفيذياً</orig> appointed by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> from among its members or from outside. This CEO shall be entrusted with the management of the company, and the Board shall define his powers and authorities to sign on behalf of the company.

### Article (28)
The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may distribute work among its members according to the nature of the company's business. The Board may also delegate one of its members, a committee from among its members, or a third party <orig>أحداً من الغير</orig> to perform one or more specific tasks, supervise an aspect of the company's activity, or exercise some of the powers or competencies entrusted to the Board.

### Article (29)
Any shareholder <orig>مساهم</orig>, whether a natural or legal person <orig>شخصاً طبيعياً أو اعتبارياً</orig>, may appoint a representative <orig>ممثل</orig> for them on the company's Board of Directors <orig>مجلس إدارة</orig> in proportion to their shareholding. The number of Board members selected in this manner shall be deducted from the total number of elected Board members. Shareholders who have representatives on the Board of Directors may not participate with other shareholders in electing the remaining Board members except to the extent exceeding the proportion used in appointing their representatives on the Board of Directors. A group of shareholders <orig>مجموعة من المساهمين</orig> may form an alliance among themselves to appoint one or more representatives for them on the Board of Directors, in proportion to their combined ownership.
These representatives shall have the same rights and obligations as elected members.
The company's General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> shall elect from among the Board members one or more independent members <orig>عضو مستقل</orig> with experience and competence. Their remuneration shall be determined according to governance rules <orig>قواعد الحوكمة</orig>, provided that their number does not exceed half of the Board members, and it is not required for the member to be a shareholder in the company.
The shareholder shall be responsible for his actions, as well as those of his representatives and Dania <orig>دانيا</orig> and its shareholders.

### Article (30)
A meeting of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall not be valid unless attended by half of the members, provided that the number of attendees is not less than three. A higher percentage or number may be agreed upon. Meetings may be held using modern communication methods <orig>وسائل الاتصال الحديثة</orig>, and resolutions may be passed by circulation <orig>بالتمرير</orig> with the approval of all Board members.
