The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must meet at least six times during the year, and a greater number of meetings may be agreed upon.
### Article (31)
Minutes of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> meetings shall be recorded and signed by the attending members and the Board Secretary <orig>أمين سر المجلس</orig>. Any member who did not approve a decision taken by the Board may record their objection in the meeting minutes.
### Article (32)
If a Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> member's position becomes vacant, it shall be filled by the shareholder who received the highest number of votes among those who did not win Board membership. If there is an impediment to that person, the next in line shall fill the position. The new member shall complete a term of only one year. However, if the vacant positions reach one-quarter of the original positions, the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must call for a General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> of shareholders to convene within two months from the date of the last vacancy, to elect those who will fill the vacant positions.
### Article (33)
The following conditions must be met by anyone nominated for membership in the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>:
1- Must possess legal capacity <orig>أهلية التصرف</orig>.
2- Must not have been previously convicted of a felony with a freedom-restricting penalty, or a crime of bankruptcy due to negligence <orig>إفلاس بالتقصير</orig> or fraud <orig>التدليس</orig>, or a crime against honor or trust <orig>مخلة بالشرف أو الأمانة</orig>, or a freedom-restricting penalty for violating legal provisions, unless their rehabilitation <orig>رد إليه اعتباره</orig> has been restored.
3- Must personally own, or the person they represent must own, a number of the company's shares. The independent Board member <orig>عضو مجلس الإدارة المستقل</orig> is exempt from this condition.
If a Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> member loses any of the aforementioned conditions, their membership shall cease from the date of losing that condition. This shall not affect the validity of the actions and decisions taken by the Board and voted upon by the member.
### Article (34)
Membership in the company's Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall not be included in the maximum number of memberships referred to in Article (234). A person may be the chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>رئيساً لمجلس إدارة</orig> of more than one closed joint-stock company <orig>شركة مساهمة مقفلة</orig>.
### Article (35)
The Chairman <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig> or a member of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, even if representing a natural or legal person, may not exploit information obtained by virtue of their position to gain benefit for themselves or others.
A Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> member may dispose of their shares in the company during their membership on the Board, without prejudice to the restrictions on share disposal stipulated in the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig>, the company's articles of association <orig>عقد الشركة</orig>, or these regulations <orig>هذا النظام</orig>.
### Article (36)
Members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may not disclose to shareholders, outside of General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> meetings, or to third parties, any company secrets they became aware of due to their management, even if they are subject to dismissal and accountability for compensating damages resulting from the violation.
### Article (37)
The Chairman <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig> or any member of the Board may not combine membership in the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس إدارة</orig> of two competing companies, or participate in any work that would compete with the company, or engage for their own account or for the account of others in any branch of activity carried out by the company. Otherwise, the company shall have the right to demand compensation from them or to consider the operations they carried out for their own account as if they were conducted for the company's account, unless this is done with the approval of the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig>.
### Article (38)
The total remuneration <orig>مكافآت</orig> of the Chairman <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig> and members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may not exceed ten percent of the net profit <orig>الربح الصافي</orig> after deducting depreciation and reserves and distributing a profit of not less than 5% of the capital to shareholders, or a higher percentage may be agreed upon. An annual remuneration not exceeding six thousand Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> may be distributed to the Chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig> and each member of this Board from the date of the company's establishment until the achievement of profits that allow for the distribution of remuneration in accordance with the preceding paragraph. By a decision issued by the company's General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>, an independent Board member <orig>عضو مجلس الإدارة المستقل</orig> may be exempted from the aforementioned maximum remuneration limit.
### Article (39)
The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> is obligated to submit an annual report to be presented to the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> for approval, provided that it accurately includes a detailed statement of the amounts, benefits, and advantages obtained by the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, regardless of their nature or designation.
### Article (40)
No person who has a representative on the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, or the Chairman <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig>, or a member of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>, or a member of the executive management <orig>الإدارة التنفيذية</orig>, or their spouses, or their second-degree relatives, may have a direct or indirect interest in contracts and dispositions concluded with or on behalf of the company, unless authorized by a resolution issued by the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig>.
### Article (41)
The company may not lend to any of its Board of Directors <orig>مجلس إدارتها</orig> members, or the Chief Executive Officer <orig>الرئيس التنفيذي</orig>, or their spouses, or their second-degree relatives, or their affiliated companies, unless there is authorization from the company's Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig>. Any action taken in violation thereof shall not be enforceable against the company, without prejudice to the rights of good-faith third parties.
### Article (42)
The Chairman <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig> and members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> are responsible towards the company, shareholders, and third parties for all acts of fraud <orig>الغش</orig>, abuse of authority <orig>إساءة استعمال السلطة</orig>, and for every violation of the law or the company's articles of association <orig>عقد الشركة</orig>, or for errors in management. A vote by the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> to discharge the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> shall not prevent the filing of a liability lawsuit. Members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may not participate in voting on General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> resolutions related to discharging them from liability for their management, or those related to a private benefit for them, their spouses, or their first-degree relatives, or to a conflict existing between them and the company.
The liability stipulated in the preceding article shall be either personal liability <orig>مسؤولية شخصية</orig> pertaining to a specific member, or joint liability <orig>مشتركة</orig> among all members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>. In the latter case, all members shall be jointly and severally liable <orig>مسؤولين جميعاً على وجه التضامن</orig> for paying compensation, except for those who objected to the decision that incurred the liability and recorded their objection in the minutes.
<page_end>173</page_end>

### Article (43)
The company may file a liability lawsuit against the members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> due to errors that cause damage to the company. If the company is in liquidation, the liquidator shall undertake to file the lawsuit.

### Article (44)
Every shareholder may file a liability lawsuit individually on behalf of the company if the company fails to do so. In this case, the company must be joined as a party to be awarded compensation if warranted. A shareholder may file a personal lawsuit for compensation if the error has caused them damage. Any agreement to the contrary shall be null and void.

### Article (45)
2- The General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>:
The Annual Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية السنوية</orig> shall convene upon an invitation from the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> within three months following the end of the financial year, at the time and place designated by the Board of Directors. The Board may call the General Assembly to a meeting whenever necessary. The Board of Directors must issue an invitation to the General Assembly upon a reasoned request from a number of shareholders owning ten percent of the company's capital, or upon a request from the auditor, within fifteen days from the date of the request. The agenda shall be prepared by the inviting party. The provisions related to the Constituent Assembly <orig>الجمعية التأسيسية</orig> stipulated in Companies Law No. 1 of 2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 1 لسنة 2016</orig> and its amendments shall apply to the procedures for calling the General Assembly, the quorum for attendance, and voting.

### Article (46)
Every shareholder, regardless of the number of their shares, has the right to attend the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig>, and shall have a number of votes equal to the number of votes allocated to the same class of shares. A shareholder may not vote on their own behalf or on behalf of someone they represent in matters related to their personal interest, or in a dispute existing between them and the company. Any condition or decision that violates this shall be null and void. A shareholder may appoint a proxy to attend on their behalf by virtue of a special power of attorney <orig>توكيل خاص</orig> or an authorization prepared by the company for this purpose. Anyone claiming a right over shares contrary to what is recorded in the company's shareholder register may apply to the judge of urgent matters <orig>قاضي الأمور الوقتية</orig> to obtain an order on a petition to deprive the disputed shares of voting for a period specified by the judge or until the dispute is settled by the competent court, in accordance with the procedures stipulated in the Civil and Commercial Procedures Law <orig>قانون المرافعات المدنية والتجارية</orig>.

### Article (47)
The General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> meeting shall be chaired by the Chairman of the Board of Directors <orig>رئيس مجلس الإدارة</orig>, or their deputy, or someone delegated by the Board of Directors for that purpose, or someone elected by the General Assembly from among the shareholders or others.

### Article (48)
Subject to the provisions of the law, the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> in its annual meeting is competent to make decisions on matters falling within its jurisdiction, and in particular the following:
1- The Board of Directors' <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> report on the company's activities and financial position for the ended financial year.
2- The auditor's report on the company's financial statements.
3- A report on any violations observed by regulatory authorities <orig>الجهات الرقابية</orig> and for which penalties were imposed on the company.
4- The company's financial statements.
5- The Board of Directors' <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> proposals regarding profit distribution.
6- Discharging the liability of the members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig>.
7- Electing or dismissing members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> and determining their remuneration.
8- Appointing the company's auditor, determining their fees, or authorizing the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> to do so.
9- Appointing the Sharia Supervisory Board <orig>هيئة الرقابة الشرعية</orig> (if the company operates in accordance with the provisions of Islamic Sharia <orig>الشريعة الإسلامية</orig>) and determining the report of that board.
10- Reporting on transactions that have occurred or will occur with related parties. Related parties are defined according to International Accounting Principles <orig>المبادئ المحاسبية الدولية</orig>.

### Article (49)
By a resolution issued by the company's Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig>, the chairman or one or more members of the Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> may be dismissed, or the company's Board of Directors may be dissolved and a new Board of Directors elected, based on a proposal submitted by a number of shareholders owning no less than a quarter of the company's issued capital. Upon the issuance of a resolution to dissolve the Board of Directors, and considering the election of a new board at the same meeting, the Assembly may decide either for the existing board to continue managing the company's affairs until the new board is elected, or to appoint a temporary administrative committee whose primary task is to call the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> to elect the new board, within one month of its appointment.

### Article (50)
The Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> may not discuss matters not included in the agenda unless they are urgent matters that arose after the agenda was prepared or became apparent during the meeting, or if requested by a regulatory authority <orig>الجهات الرقابية</orig>, the auditor, or a number of shareholders owning five percent of the company's capital. If, during the discussion, it becomes clear that the information related to some presented matters is insufficient, the meeting must be postponed for a period not exceeding ten working days if requested by a number of shareholders owning a quarter of the issued capital. The postponed meeting shall convene without the need for new invitation procedures.

### Article (51)
The Board of Directors <orig>مجلس الإدارة</orig> must implement the resolutions of the General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة</orig> unless those resolutions violate the law, the articles of incorporation <orig>عقد التأسيس</orig>, or these bylaws. The Board of Directors must re-present the violating resolutions to the Ordinary General Assembly <orig>الجمعية العامة العادية</orig> in a meeting called to discuss the aspects of the violation.
<page_end>174</page_end>

### Article (52)
The provisions related to the Ordinary General Assembly shall apply to the Extraordinary General Assembly, taking into account the provisions stipulated in Articles 53 to 56 of these Articles of Association.

### Article (53)
The Extraordinary General Assembly shall convene upon an invitation from the Board of Directors or upon a reasoned request from shareholders representing fifteen percent of the company's issued capital or from the Ministry of Commerce and Industry / Wizarat Al-Tijara wa Al-Sina'a <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>. The Board of Directors must invite the Extraordinary General Assembly to convene within thirty days from the date of submitting the request.
If the Board of Directors fails to invite the General Assembly within the period stipulated in the preceding paragraph, the Ministry shall issue the invitation for the meeting within fifteen days from the date of expiry of the period referred to in the preceding paragraph.

### Article (54)
The meeting of the Extraordinary General Assembly shall not be valid unless attended by shareholders representing three-quarters of the company's issued capital. If this quorum is not met, an invitation shall be issued for a second meeting, which shall be valid if attended by those representing more than half of the issued capital.
Resolutions shall be issued by a majority exceeding half of the total shares of the company's issued capital.

### Article (55)
Without prejudice to other competencies stipulated by law, the Extraordinary General Assembly shall be competent in the following matters:
1- Amending the company's Articles of Association.
2- Selling the entire project for which the company was established or disposing of it in any other way.
3- Dissolving the company, or its merger, transformation, or division.
4- Increasing or decreasing the company's capital.

### Article (56)
Any resolution issued by the Extraordinary General Assembly shall not be effective until the publication procedures are completed.
The approval of the Ministry of Commerce and Industry / Wizarat Al-Tijara wa Al-Sina'a <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig> must be obtained if the resolution relates to the company's name, objectives, or capital.

### Article (57)
Any shareholder may file a lawsuit for the nullity of any resolution issued by the Board of Directors or the Ordinary or Extraordinary General Assembly that violates the law, the company's Articles of Incorporation, or these Articles of Association, or that is intended to harm the company's interests, and claim compensation when necessary. The nullity lawsuit shall lapse after two months from the date of the General Assembly's resolution or the shareholder's knowledge of the Board of Directors' resolution. Appeals may also be filed against resolutions of the Ordinary and Extraordinary General Assemblies that prejudice the rights of the minority. The appeal shall be filed by a number of the company's shareholders owning fifteen percent of the company's issued capital, provided they did not approve those resolutions. The lawsuit shall lapse

### Article (58)
For a holding company, the company shall be jointly and severally liable for the debts of its subsidiary partners if the following conditions are met:
1- Insufficiency of the subsidiary company's funds to meet its obligations.
2- The company or its subsidiaries own a percentage of its capital that enables it to control the appointment of the majority of the members of the Board of Directors or managers, or the decisions issued by the management.
3- The subsidiary company takes decisions or performs actions aimed at serving the interest of the owning and controlling company, harming the interest of the subsidiary company or its creditors, and being the main reason for the subsidiary company's inability to meet its obligations.
All of the above, unless the closed company is liable for the debts of the subsidiary company based on another reason.

### Article (59)
The company's financial year shall begin on the first of (January) and end on the last of (December) of each year, with the exception of the first financial year, which shall begin from the date of the company's registration in the Commercial Register and end in December of the following financial year.

### Article (60)
Annually, by a resolution issued by the Ordinary General Assembly based on a proposal from the Board of Directors, a percentage of not less than ten percent of the net profits shall be deducted to form a statutory reserve for the company.
The General Assembly may stop this deduction if the statutory reserve exceeds half of the company's issued capital.
The statutory reserve may only be used to cover the company's losses or to ensure the distribution of profits to shareholders at a rate not exceeding five percent of the paid-up capital in years when the company's profits do not allow for the distribution of this percentage, due to the absence of an optional reserve that permits the distribution of this percentage of profits.
What was deducted from the statutory reserve must be returned to it when the profits of subsequent years allow, unless this reserve exceeds half of the issued capital.
Also, (1%) shall be deducted for the account of the Kuwait Foundation for the Advancement of Sciences / Mu'assasat Al-Kuwait lil-Taqaddum Al-Ilmi <orig>مؤسسة الكويت للتقدم العلمي</orig> from the company's net profit.

### Article (61)
Annually, a percentage shall be deducted from the non-net profits, determined by the Board of Directors after consulting the auditor, for the depreciation of the company's assets or compensation for their decrease in value. These funds shall be used to purchase necessary materials, machinery, and facilities or to repair them, and these funds may not be distributed to shareholders.

### Article (62)
A percentage shall be deducted and allocated to the optional reserve account, proposed by the Board of Directors and approved by the General Assembly. This deduction shall be stopped by a resolution of### Article (72)

### Article (63)
Annually, by a resolution issued by the Ordinary General Assembly based on the Board of Directors' proposal, a percentage not exceeding ten percent of the net profits may be deducted to form an optional reserve allocated for purposes determined by the Assembly.
### Article (64)
Subject to the provisions contained in the company's articles of association, the Ordinary General Assembly, based on the Board of Directors' proposal, may distribute profits to shareholders at the end of the fiscal year or the end of each financial period. For this distribution to be valid, it must be from actual profits, in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles, and must not affect the company's paid-up capital.
### Article (65)
Auditor:
The provisions of the articles contained in Companies Law No. 1/2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 2016/1</orig> and its amendments, specifically articles from No. 227 to 232, shall apply.
### Article (66)
The company must prepare, at the end of each fiscal year, a consolidated balance sheet and statements of profit and loss for itself and all its affiliated partners, accompanied by explanations and data as required by international accounting standards.
### Article (67)
Dissolution and Liquidation of the Company:
The company shall be dissolved by one of the matters stipulated in articles from No. 266 to 277 of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig>, its amendments, and its executive regulations.
### Article (68)
The liquidation of the company shall be carried out as specified in the provisions of articles from No. 278 to 295 of the Companies Law <orig>قانون الشركات</orig>, its amendments, and its executive regulations.
### Article (69)
The provisions of Companies Law No. 1/2016 <orig>قانون الشركات رقم 2016/1</orig>, its amendments, and its executive regulations shall apply to all matters not specifically provided for in the articles of incorporation or in these bylaws.
### Article (70)
An original copy of this contract shall be kept at the company's main office and on its website. An original copy of this contract shall also be kept in the company's file with the competent department at the Ministry of Commerce and Industry <orig>وزارة التجارة والصناعة</orig>.
### Article (71)
The founders acknowledge the following:
First: That they have subscribed to all shares and deposited the amount required by law to be paid from their value in one of the local banks at the company's disposal.
Second: That they have appointed the necessary administrative bodies for the management of the company.
Fourth: Preservation of supporting papers and documents for the aforementioned declarations with the official editor.

# Ministry of Electricity, Water and Renewable Energy <orig>وزارة الكهرباء والماء والطاقة المتجددة</orig>
## Announcement
- The Ministry of Electricity, Water and Renewable Energy <orig>وزارة الكهرباء والماء والطاقة المتجددة</orig> announces the offering of the practices mentioned below. Practice documents can be obtained electronically from the website:
.https://eprocurement.mew.gov.kw
<table_caption>Ministry of Electricity, Water and Renewable Energy Tender Dates</table_caption>
<table>
| Offer Date: | 2024/12/8 |
|:---|:---|
| Closing Date: | 2025/1/8 |
| Document Price: | As stated on the website and in the attached table. |
| Initial Deposit: | As stated on the website and in the attached table, valid for 90 days in favor of the Ministry of Electricity, Water and Renewable Energy <orig>وزارة الكهرباء والماء والطاقة المتجددة</orig> and non-refundable. |
| Final Time for Submitting Bids: | At 10:30 AM on the day specified in the announcement below for depositing bids. No bid received thereafter will be accepted. |
| The cash equivalent mentioned on the website is to be paid electronically. | |
</table>

- A valid certificate of compliance with the national labor percentage, issued by the Ministry of Social Affairs and Labor <orig>وزارة الشئون الاجتماعية والعمل</orig>, must be attached with the bid.
- Bids must be submitted with a certificate from the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig> confirming the company's registration for the year 2026/2025.
- Documents must be placed in sealed envelopes, stamped with red wax, clearly marked with the practice number and subject. They should be deposited in the bids box located at the Procurement and Supplies Department <orig>إدارة المشتريات والتوريدات</orig> in the main building of the Ministry of Electricity, Water and Renewable Energy <orig>وزارة الكهرباء والماء والطاقة المتجددة</orig> in South Surra <orig>جنوب السرة</orig>, Sixth Ring Road <orig>الدائري السادس</orig>, Ground Floor.
- This announcement is considered an integral part of the practice documents.
- For additional information and other conditions, please refer to the website of the (Ministry of Electricity, Water and Renewable Energy <orig>وزارة الكهرباء والماء والطاقة المتجددة</orig> . Procurement Department <orig>إدارة المشتريات</orig>):
.https://eprocurement.mew.gov.kw

## Announcement

The Public Authority for Applied Education and Training (PAAET) <orig>الهيئة العامة للتعليم التطبيقي والتدريب</orig> announces the publication of an advertisement for temporary exploitation No. (7) for the year 2024/2025 for the First Health Festival at the Employees' Club (football field) in Adailiya <orig>العديلية</orig> area for two days (from 07/01/2025 until 08/01/2025), from 10:00 AM to 8:00 PM, with the participation of specialized companies to provide (nineteen) diverse services mentioned in the attached table.
Circular No. (1) for the year 2023 regarding tenders in public entities, issued by the Ministry of Finance <orig>وزارة المالية</orig>, is considered complementary and supplementary to the announcement for the temporary exploitation of public state properties.
Companies and institutions wishing to participate in this temporary exploitation must visit the Public Authority for Applied Education and Training (PAAET) <orig>الهيئة العامة للتعليم التطبيقي والتدريب</orig> website (www.paaet.edu.kw) to participate. Bids must be submitted to the Authority's General Headquarters, located in Shuwaikh <orig>الشويخ</orig> Educational Area – Supplies Department, 7th Floor, within (one week) from this date, no later than 1:00 PM on Sunday, 22/12/2024.
Note:
- Small and Medium-sized Enterprises (SMEs) <orig>المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig> approved by the National Fund for SME Development <orig>الصندوق الوطني لرعاية وتنمية المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig> must provide proof of this (a certificate approved by the National Fund <orig>الصندوق الوطني</orig>).

- Attach a copy of the company's articles of association, valid national labor percentage, company civil ID number, authorized signatory, tax clearance certificate, company email address, company number, and authorized signatory.
- The bidder must have high competence and experience in the service to be exploited.

The practice is open to all companies and establishments specialized in the required works and registered with the Public Authority for Sport / Al-Hay'a Al-Amma lil-Riyada <orig>الهيئة العامة للرياضة</orig> and the Central Agency for Public Tenders / Al-Jihaz Al-Markazi lil-Munakasat Al-Amma <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig> for the year 2024, for a non-refundable fee of (75 K.D.) seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only, payable via K-Net (not refundable except in cases stipulated by Ministry of Finance / Wizarat Al-Maliya <orig>وزارة المالية</orig> circulars), bringing with them the following:
1- A copy of the practice announcement in the Official Gazette / Al-Jarida Al-Rasmiya <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.
2- A copy of the company's registration with the Public Authority for Sport / Al-Hay'a Al-Amma lil-Riyada <orig>الهيئة العامة للرياضة</orig> for the year 2024.

- Owners of small and medium enterprises / Al-Mashrou'at Al-Saghira wal-Mutawassita <orig>المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig> wishing to apply for the practice must attach with their bid a valid certificate issued by the National Fund for the Care and Development of Small and Medium Enterprises / Al-Sunduq Al-Watani li-Ri'ayat wa Tanmiyat Al-Mashrou'at Al-Saghira wal-Mutawassita <orig>الصندوق الوطني لرعاية وتنمية المشروعات الصغيرة والمتوسطة</orig>, including its accreditation as a small or medium enterprise.
In accordance with Article (48) of Public Tenders Law No. 49 of 2016, which states: "Bid envelopes shall be opened at the time and place specified in the practice documents in a public session attended by bidders or their representatives."
- This announcement is considered an invitation for interested practitioners to attend, as companies wishing to attend the bid opening session have the right to coordinate with the competent committee before the session date.
- This announcement is an integral part of the practice documents.
Note: The Authority may cancel the practice without stating reasons and without any objection from the practitioners.

| 2024/12/15 | 2024/12/26 | 75 K.D. | 1400 K.D. | None |

The deadline for submitting bids is Thursday, 2024/12/26, until 12:00 PM. Bids shall be delivered to the main headquarters of the Public Authority for Industry / Al-Hay'a Al-Amma lil-Sina'a <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig> (Second Floor – Supplies and Stores Department / Idarat Al-Tawridat wal-Makhazin <orig>إدارة التوريدات والمخازن</orig> – Procurement Section / Qism Al-Mushtariyat <orig>قسم المشتريات</orig>) in an envelope bearing the name of the practice. Bids shall be valid for a period of (90) days from the date of opening the bid envelopes.
The practitioner must submit a recent certificate of concern issued by the Public Authority for Manpower / Al-Hay'a Al-Amma lil-Quwa Al-Amila <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig> stating that there is no suspension on the company's file regarding government contracts registered with the Public Authority for Manpower / Al-Hay'a Al-Amma lil-Quwa Al-Amila <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>, and a certificate of concern confirming the fulfillment of the national labor percentage, dated contemporaneously with the bid date. The practitioner must also deposit with their bid an initial security in the form of a certified check or an unconditional, unreserved, and irrevocable letter of guarantee issued in the name of the bidder by one of the accredited banks in the State of Kuwait / Dawlat Al-Kuwait <orig>دولة الكويت</orig> and in favor of the Public Authority for Industry / Al-Hay'a Al-Amma lil-Sina'a <orig>الهيئة العامة للصناعة</orig>, valid for the duration of the bid. Any bid not accompanied by the full security will be excluded. The initial security may not be refunded until (90) days have passed from the closing date of the practice or when the winning practitioner signs the contract, unless the practice is canceled. The Authority will not pay any interest on the amount of this security, and the practitioner's creditors may not seize its amount, noting that this practice is indivisible.

# Directorate General of Civil Aviation <orig>الإدارة العامة للطيران المدني</orig>
## Announcement Regarding Tender No. (1-T4-2024/2025) Duty-Free Operations at Terminal 4, Kuwait International Airport

The Directorate General of Civil Aviation <orig>الإدارة العامة للطيران المدني</orig> announces the extension of the closing period for Tender No. (1-T4-2024/2025) for duty-free operations at Terminal 4, Kuwait International Airport. The new deadline for submitting offers will be at (1:00 PM) on (Sunday), corresponding to (2024/12/15), instead of (Wednesday), corresponding to (2025/1/12).
Any offer submitted after this deadline will be rejected.

## Announcement Regarding Tender No. (16-T4-2024/2025) Baggage Handling Services at Terminal 4, Kuwait International Airport

The Directorate General of Civil Aviation <orig>الإدارة العامة للطيران المدني</orig> announces the extension of the closing period for Tender No. (16-T4-2024/2025) for baggage handling services at Terminal 4, Kuwait International Airport. The new deadline for submitting offers will be at (1:00 PM) on (Wednesday), corresponding to (2024/12/18), instead of (Tuesday), corresponding to (2025/1/7).
Any offer submitted after this deadline will be rejected.

## Announcement
# Practice No. (19 - 2024/2025) Maintenance of Surveillance Camera System at Kuwait International Airport, Terminal 1

The Directorate General of Civil Aviation <orig>الإدارة العامة للطيران المدني</orig> announces Practice No. (19-2024/2025) for the maintenance of the surveillance camera system at Kuwait International Airport, Terminal 1, in accordance with the terms and specifications mentioned in the practice documents. These documents can be obtained from the Financial Affairs Department – Tenders and Contracts Section at the Directorate General of Civil Aviation <orig>الإدارة العامة للطيران المدني</orig> starting from (Sunday), corresponding to (2024/12/15), during official working hours, upon payment of an amount of (75 K.D.) (seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only), provided that payment is made via (k.net).
A preliminary meeting will be held at the headquarters of the Directorate General of Civil Aviation <orig>الإدارة العامة للطيران المدني</orig> on (Sunday), corresponding to (2024/12/22), at (12:00 PM).
The documents, once completed and accompanied by the required supporting documents and an initial security deposit of no less than (2%) of the bid value in the form of a certified check or a letter of guarantee issued by one of the accredited banks in the State of Kuwait, and issued in the name of the bidder and in favor of the Directorate General of Civil Aviation <orig>الإدارة العامة للطيران المدني</orig>, without any restrictions or conditions, must be returned. Bids not accompanied by this security deposit will not be considered, even if they conform to the specifications. The security deposit must be valid for the required bid validity period. The documents must be submitted in an official envelope sealed with red wax. Offers will be submitted by (1:00 PM) on (Sunday), corresponding to (2024/12/29), and any offer submitted after this deadline will be rejected.

## Announcement
The Central Statistical Bureau <orig>الإدارة المركزية للإحصاء</orig> announces its desire to issue Practice No. (5-2024/2025) related to providing maintenance and technical support services for storage capacity and its accessories for the Central Statistical Bureau <orig>الإدارة المركزية للإحصاء</orig>. Specialized companies wishing to apply for this practice must observe the following:
1.  The company must be registered with the Central Statistical Bureau <orig>الإدارة المركزية للإحصاء</orig>.
2.  The applying company must have experience in this field prior to the issuance of this announcement, with proof thereof.
3.  The Central Statistical Bureau <orig>الإدارة المركزية للإحصاء</orig> will begin issuing the practice terms starting from the date of publication of this announcement and for a period of 10 days.
4.  The practice terms can be obtained from the Financial Affairs Department <orig>إدارة الشئون المالية</orig> for a non-refundable fee of (75 K.D.) seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً كويتياً</orig> only.
5.  A preliminary meeting with the bidders will be held on Thursday, 19/12/2024, at 11:00 AM in the building of the General Secretariat of the Supreme Council for Planning <orig>الأمانة العامة للمجلس الأعلى للتخطيط</orig>.
6.  Offers must be submitted in a sealed envelope to the Financial Affairs Department <orig>إدارة الشئون المالية</orig> of the Central Statistical Bureau <orig>الإدارة المركزية للإحصاء</orig> no later than 1:00 PM on Thursday, 26/12/2024.

### Announcement 2024/133
The holder of the following license has submitted a request to the Municipality:
<table_caption>License Holder Information</table_caption>

| Commercial Name | Kuwaiti Construction Center Company <orig>شركه المركز الكويتي للبناء</orig> |

requesting the release of the company's bank guarantees deposited with the Municipality in consideration of its classification.
Based on Article (19) of Municipality Resolution No. (2009/161) regarding the classification, licensing, and registration of building and demolition contractors in Kuwait Municipality <orig>بلدية الكويت</orig>, which stipulates that a contractor may submit a request to the Municipality to cancel their registration before its expiry or to cancel the classification, and the committee stipulated in Article One of this regulation may issue its decision to that effect after fulfilling the following two conditions:
1. The contractor has completed all contracted works.
2. Fifteen (15) days have passed from the date of publication of this request in the Official Gazette <orig>الجريدة الرسمية</orig>.
The cancellation of the license or registration entails the return of the bank guarantee submitted by the contractor, taking into account the last paragraph of Article (10) of this resolution.
Accordingly, the Municipality appeals to anyone who has any claims against the aforementioned contractor regarding construction contracts concluded between them that have not yet been completed, or judicial attachments in their favor due to violating contracting works or dues arising from the contracting agreement, to review the Contractors Section <orig>قسم المقاولين</orig> at the Engineering Systems Department <orig>إدارة الأنظمة الهندسية</orig> within a maximum period of fifteen days from this date. The Municipality will not consider any claims submitted after the prescribed period.
Director General of the Municipality <orig>مدير عام البلدية</orig>

## Tender Announcement No. (06- 2024/2025)
### Supply, Installation, and Operation of Medical Devices and Equipment
The Committee for Military Material Purchases and Military Facilities Contracts at the National Guard <orig>الحرس الوطني</orig> announces a tender for the supply, installation, and operation of medical devices and equipment, open to specialized companies and establishments in accordance with the general and special conditions stipulated in the tender documents. Therefore, companies and establishments wishing to participate in this tender must register on the official website of the General Presidency of the National Guard <orig>الرئاسة العامة للحرس الوطني</orig> (www.kng.gov.kw) to purchase the tender documents for a non-refundable fee of (K.D. 75/-) seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only, payable through the National Guard <orig>الحرس الوطني</orig> website using the (K-NET) service. A preliminary meeting will be held at 10:00 AM on Monday, December 23, 2024, at the General Presidency of the National Guard <orig>الرئاسة العامة للحرس الوطني</orig>, Colonel Staff / Faisal Al-Jareed <orig>فيصل الجريد</orig> Building. Whether the bidder attends this meeting or not, they will be bound by all decisions, recommendations, or clarifications contained therein. For any inquiries, please call the switchboard at (24999999), extensions (66735-66787), fax (24999858).

## Announcement of Practice No. (09- 2024/2025) for the Supply, Installation, and Operation of Floodlights for Al-Sumoud Camp <orig>معسكر الصمود</orig> Field
The Committee for Military Material Purchases and Military Facilities Contracts at the National Guard <orig>الحرس الوطني</orig> announces a practice for the supply and operation of floodlights for Al-Sumoud Camp <orig>معسكر الصمود</orig> Field, open to specialized companies and establishments in accordance with the general and special conditions stipulated in the practice documents. Therefore, companies and establishments wishing to participate in this practice must register on the official website of the General Presidency of the National Guard <orig>الرئاسة العامة للحرس الوطني</orig> (www.kng.gov.kw) to purchase the practice documents for a non-refundable fee of (K.D. 75/-) seventy-five Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig> only, payable through the National Guard <orig>الحرس الوطني</orig> website using the (K-NET) service. A preliminary meeting will be held at 10:00 AM on Sunday, December 22, 2024, at the General Presidency of the National Guard <orig>الرئاسة العامة للحرس الوطني</orig>, Colonel Staff / Faisal Al-Jareed <orig>فيصل الجريد</orig> Building. Whether the practitioner attends this meeting or not, they will be bound by all decisions, recommendations, or clarifications contained therein. Participating companies and establishments must print the minutes of the preliminary meeting from the National Guard <orig>الحرس الوطني</orig> website (www.kng.gov.kw). Please note that the deadline for submitting bids is 1:00 PM on Sunday, December 29, 2024. Note: Companies and establishments wishing to purchase the practice documents must provide us with a copy of the purchase receipt. Companies classified as small and medium-sized enterprises must provide a certificate proving this. For any inquiries, please call the switchboard at (24999999), extensions (66735-66787), fax (24999858).

The Kuwait Fund for Arab Economic Development <orig>الصندوق الكويتي للتنمية الاقتصادية العربية</orig> announces the offering of Practice No. (2024/133) regarding the supply and installation of wood and glass partitions with doors at the Kuwait Fund for Development <orig>الصندوق الكويتي للتنمية</orig>.

Companies and institutions specialized in this field wishing to participate in this practice should visit the official website of the Kuwait Fund for Arab Economic Development <orig>الصندوق الكويتي للتنمية الاقتصادية العربية</orig> (www.kuwait-fund.org) or the e-government website (www.e.gov.kw) for a non-refundable fee of (40 K.D.) forty Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>ديناراً كويتياً</orig> only. The deadline for submitting bids is 1:00 PM on Monday, 2025/01/06. Bids shall remain valid and cannot be withdrawn for a period of (90) ninety days from the date of opening the bid envelopes. The bidder must also deposit with their bid a preliminary security deposit of not less than 2% of the bid value, and this security must be valid and effective for the duration of the bid's validity.

Acting Deputy Director General

# Public Authority for Housing Welfare <orig>المؤسسة العامة للرعاية السكنية</orig>
## Public Tender Announcement
### No.: PAHW/ 1238-2024/2025
For the construction, completion, and maintenance of the Youth Center Building, Block 2, in Saad Al-Abdullah Residential City Project

<table_caption>Tender Schedule and Guarantee Details</table_caption>
<table>
| Submission Date | Closing Date | Document Sale Price | Initial Guarantee |
|:------|:-------|:---|:---|
| 2024/12/15 | 2025/01/16 | K.D. 3,500/- | K.D. 150,000/- valid for (90) days |
</table>

Current companies executing public building projects that meet the list of foundations and criteria required from bidders are invited to purchase tender documents, submitting all documents and papers according to the requirements, fulfilling the conditions, and in the manner stipulated.

First: Tender documents can be obtained from the Documents and Contracts Department – Third Floor – Public Authority for Housing Welfare <orig>المؤسسة العامة للرعاية السكنية</orig> – South Surra, according to the following conditions and requirements when purchasing tender documents:
1.  Submission of a registration certificate issued by the Commercial Register at the Ministry of Commerce <orig>وزارة التجارة</orig>, a registration certificate from the Kuwait Chamber of Commerce and Industry <orig>غرفة تجارة وصناعة الكويت</orig>, the company's articles of association, a company registration certificate with the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig>, and a classification certificate in the civil and construction works category. (A recent certificate for the year of the tender announcement).
2.  Tender documents shall be handed over against a non-refundable amount as specified in the table above, by a certified check issued in favor of the Public Authority for Housing Welfare <orig>المؤسسة العامة للرعاية السكنية</orig> or a K-Net card.
3.  Submission of an authorization letter from the company in the name of the authorized person to purchase tender documents, attaching a copy of the civil ID of the same authorized person and a signature authentication certificate.
4.  Submission of a valid national labor percentage fulfillment certificate issued by the Public Authority for Manpower <orig>الهيئة العامة للقوى العاملة</orig>.
5.  Companies that have received a valid penalty in state tenders and projects will not be allowed to participate.
6.  Companies with ongoing (under execution) contracts that are delayed in delivering any part of the project beyond the contractual completion date by a delay percentage exceeding (50%) of the total contract duration will not be allowed to bid for a new tender until the contract under execution is settled.

Second: Qualification Documents (Foundations and Criteria):
The bidder is committed to submitting all required documents proving compliance with all conditions and requirements of the foundations and criteria with the bid documents, placing them inside the envelope designated for the foundations and criteria requirements as follows:
1.  The company's establishment or the individual's practice of the activity must have been for more than (5) years.
2.  The capital of the company or the assets owned by the individual must not be less than (K.D. 5,000,000) five million Kuwaiti Dinars <orig>دينار كويتي</orig>.
3.  Submission of complete financial statements for the last (3) financial years of the company (income statement, statement of financial position, cash flow statement, statement of changes in equity) approved by a financial auditing office in Kuwait and accompanied by financial reports, and bank certificates from the banks the company deals with.
4.  The bidder must have previous experience similar to the nature of the tendered works (public building works) and must have executed projects as a main contractor in the field of specialization through the Central Agency for Public Tenders <orig>الجهاز المركزي للمناقصات العامة</orig> or other governmental bodies or companies or institutions affiliated with the government in the State of Kuwait during the last ten years as follows:
    *   - One or two projects for works similar to the subject of the contract, with a combined value of not less than K.D. 3 million.
    *   It is necessary to provide copies of the above-required projects that show the project value and its duration, and completion certificates issued by the entities contracted to execute the works for the same projects must also be provided.
    *   - Maintenance projects are not acceptable.
    *   - Subcontracts are not acceptable.
    *   - Multi-work order projects are not acceptable.
5.  A statement of the equipment, machinery, and tools owned or leased by the contractor must be submitted with proof thereof, provided that they are suitable for the nature and volume of the works to perform their work as required.

# Announcement
The Kuwait Institute for Scientific Research <orig>معهد الكويت للأبحاث العلمية</orig> announces Tender -M-107-2024/2025 for the repair of a Gas Chromatograph Mass Spectrometer. Tender documents can be obtained from the Institute's website at:

### 4- Overview of the Tender Works:
The scope involves reviewing KAFCO's tank farm locations at new and old depots concerning airport facilities, compliance with international standards, and socio-environmental impacts. It includes conducting a Quantitative Risk Analysis (QRA) to assess potential hazards, consequences, and risks to personnel and nearby areas, and providing recommendations to mitigate risks to ALARP levels. Detailed reports and presentations are required, incorporating KAFCO's feedback for final approval

### 5- The tender closing date is at 1:00 PM on Sunday, 12/01/2025 AD. Bids must be submitted at the Kuwait Aviation Fuelling Company <orig>الشركة الكويتية لتزويد الطائرات بالوقود</orig> (KAFCO) building, and no bids will be accepted after the specified deadline.

### 6- The validity period of the preliminary bond shall be (90) days from the closing date.

### 7- The preliminary meeting date is at 11:00 AM on Sunday, 22/12/2024 AD, noting that the meeting will be held at the Kuwait Aviation Fuelling Company <orig>الشركة الكويتية لتزويد الطائرات بالوقود</orig> (KAFCO) headquarters – Basement – Meeting Room.

### 8- The last date for participating companies to submit any inquiries, reservations, or requests regarding this tender is 22/12/2024 AD, and these requests will not be considered for any reason after this specified deadline.

### 9- The final time for submitting bids is 1:00 PM on the day specified in the above announcement for depositing bids. Bids shall be deposited in a sealed envelope in the special bid box located at the company's headquarters.
